page.title: 07LOWER REDCAR FARM cont.
page.content: This farm has a milking parlour which holds ten cows.The cows are milked twice daily at 6.00am and at 5.00pm. Milk production is now limited by milk quotas.This came into effect last year when milk production was limited to the amount produced in 1983.The milk quota at this farm is 404,000 litres per year.The milk is taken by tanker to the main Milk Marketing Board Depot at Leeds. In 1983, a Government grant was obtained to support the reclaiming of an acre of moorland which is now used for grazing.A building for housing farm machinery was also supported by the Government. Sheep are grazed on the rough moorland and in Autumn the fattened lambs are sold at Bingley Auction Mart.
